comments.content: Hulu 2/20!!! Counting each moment till then!!!

I have a tape of this episode and do love it. Dixie and I became friends and I absolutely adored her. We met at Delta and Mac's wedding in Los Angeles  and adored both she and her husband Hal Holbrook. Hal sat behind us during the service and our photo ... See More
No one could tell you off like Julia Sugarbaker!!!
What rant by Julia wasn't good?  They were all priceless. Another one of my favorites is the Ray Don rant.  Oh, didn't you also love it when Mary-Jo got a few drinks in her?  She was hilarious!!!
I love me some Julia!!! Oh how I miss that show...
Ok! To any southern women Julia Sugarbaker is what is taught in finishing school, when a Bless their heart just won't due! To a gay man, ... See More
Julia is my GIRL! She was the reason I watched designing women..!!!
Love this show and yes Julia is the original "I'm gone check you boo"! Chick!!
Julia was hands-down my FAVORITE! Sometimes I'll watch episodes and fast-forward to her rants (anybody remember the ski weekend? One of my favorite rants!).
I loved that show. She and Claire Huxtable had the best way to tell people off. I am so bad at finding the right words when needed so I always admired their ability to do it with such class.
Love me some Julia Sugarbaker!! Let her tell ya bout crazy folks in the south, we don't hide them we sit um on the front porch braggin bout how many we have in the family!!!
Dixie Carter was the greatest. Wish they were still being aired. Miss her and the show Designing Women
Kaz Krasovskis  screw the Damages scene. Let's do THIS one! . You can be Julia Sugarbaker...  ðŸ¤£
Wendy Walker  remember  I used to watch this  show? Julia Sugarbaker  used to get them right. ....and that is the night the lights went out in GEOR-GA! YES!

I love the one where she walks by the construction site. When she gets to the office she then tells them how the men cat called her who baby work it out shake that thing mama you sure look good or something like that
I was just telling someone the other day about this episode and how she goes to bat for Suzanne and puts that girl in her place. "The night the lights went out in Georga"!!
This is how you have your sisters back. You stick together no matter what goes down and who says what  Jada Powell Lenise Bryant
Raving fan of Designing Women and got to meet Dixie Carter in person when she was guest speaker at a women's conference. I would not miss an episode in those days. Miss the show!
Love Julia she was a queen. I love designing women miss that watched it every morning getting ready for work
I love how she got that woman TOGETHER and then promptly and ever so cooly calmed herself before leaving the room...Yes Julia...YES. lol
This was so good Another great rant was when they were planning the funeral for a gay man dying of AIDS and someone didn't approve. She put that woman in her place!
Michele Meddler  this is me if anyone try and said anything about you!!!!

One of the best tv shows EVER... Evening Shade being the other !   Linda Bloodworth Thomason is an amazing writer/ producer.  We need More of her on tv.  Not just hysterically funny, but no political holds barred.  Love her stuff !!!

Loved the show and that scene was one of my favorites! What shocked me was when I found out ( while on vacation) that the "Sugarbaker " home was actually in Little Rock, Arkansas and Susanne's home was filmed in the actual Governors mansion a few blocks from there.

I LOVED that Show  !! And Especially Julia Sugarbaker  !!! She is one Tuff, loveable,  loyal Southern Gal....that won't take any B.S. from ANYBODY !!  Wonder what she would think of this Presidential Election  ???

Julia Sugarbaker/Dixie Carter was EVERYTHING! She was a BOSS before we started using the word! I will always think wonderfully on Dixie Carter and Bea Arthur's Maude for showing us strong women who kicked ass in a time when we women were still required to take sewing, cooking, shorthand and typing in school if you were a girl.
Love Julia, she doesn't hold back on nobody and she does it with class, lol. Miss this show.

This was the episode that caused all my friends to start calling me Julia Sugarbaker!! My favorite episode of series with the one where her old friend?? Comes in and makes a snide remark about a friend with AIDS and she lets her have it!!
Michelle Guiral  and this is you. This is loyal family. Joan should watch as an example on how to act. Love this clip. Soooooo you. And obviously I'm the sister you're protecting.
Kellen Van Horn , i always thought of myself as more of a Julia Sugarbaker. But now I think you have an awfully uncanny capacity to channel Mizzz Sugarbaker, my Ride or Die bff.

Thank you,  Carol G Glidden  for introducing me to The Sugarbakers as a child. I've twirled batons, been a beauty queen, drive a my "big, American luxury liner", and have quoted this episode more times than I could count. This was the greatest show! Loved Julia and Suzanne!

Love how Julia could put you in your place!   They just started showing Designing Women reruns on a new cable channel ATT Uverse added called FETV, I think that is Family entertainment TV. I have been DVR-ing it every day!
One of the best compliments which I ever received was from a young woman who told me that I was a role model for her and she compared me to Julia Sugarbaker!  This episode was one of my favorites.
So wonderful of you to share your story. I took time to view your page. You are a very interesting person. May God bless you in all your endeavors. Let me know when you book is completed.

Many of Julia's comebacks that will sit you back down and shut your mouth lol I loved her in this show I use to make it a ritual to watch Golden girls. And Designing woman before I fell asleep I miss this kind of tv watching  ðŸ’œ ðŸ’œ ðŸ’œ

Ms. Julia had a way to cut you down to size without even cursing you, an quality I learned from her and my mother, and I have been told I do it SO well, LOL!!!  I salute you Julia for joining with my mom in my raising of how to be a Southern Belle!!
And that is how you are suppose to stand up for your baby sister. Julia hit the nail on the head. Kudos!!! Makes me proud to say I have been raised in Georgia!!! I miss that show.
My kids have always called me Julia Sugarbaker because of my righteous rants I suppose. I don't mind. I think she was a wonderful role model!! Ha

My favorite was when Mary Jo was thinking about getting breast implants and had the fake bra to "try out" the different sizes. When they went into the bar so she could check out "how they worked", I thought I'd die laughing.

Pam Wiggins Sullivan   I would do this for you, you know. Sisters are special and I love my baby sister with all my heart. I wish we spent more time together. I miss your smiles and more than that the talks we had and stuff we shared. Love you sister.
I loved watching Designing Women! All the women on the show were great examples of strong  Southern Belles!
This reminds me of me sweet little sister Kristy Williams Bishop I wish I could be half the woman she thinks I am so I keep trying! Can't let a sister like that down.!!!
I saw this and rolled so hard she read her the riot act talk about tearing her a new azz she did don't piss a southern girl off especially a sugar baby.  Always a lady.
This has always been one of my favorite Julia moments  . I still  watch the show and love her sassy attitude.

My favorite is when they are in Las Vegas and Charlene has a little to much to drink and is talking about the movie Deliverence, "I'll make you squeal like a pig" I tried to find a clip but, I couldn't.
The power of a woman. When you can talk without any profanity or without degrading another woman and still get your point across makes you FIERCE!!!
My fav episode was Suzanne and Anthony when they went to a pageant together and wound up sleeping in same bed. So fun. The DVDs are on Amazon.
I loved this show, used to watch it every week, Susanne was a toss up for favorite, and I lived the old lady with Anthony, hysterical. Thanks for reminding me about the show  Linda Parnell

Thank you everyone who put these episodes on here.  I used to like watching these when I was younger. And thank you for putting the name of it on there because I could not remember. I think I will try to get these episodes again to watch them in my life now. God bless everyone thank you.
I love this episode!!!! I loved the show!!! Julia Sugarbaker could put people in there place right quick like !!

comments.content: I have met some really funny people who mask their sadness with laughter.  Joy really can be a strength....when it is real joy.  Anytime we try to hide the truth....it comes bobbing up to the surface eventually...often in not the most opportune times.. ... See More

When I  can draw a little smile on someone's  face  could be just a passer by ..and not an intimate person to me,all my grief turns into complete happiness.Making others happy is real happiness .I do believe in this magical power..
Robin was a very wise and smart man. Knew how to hide his fears, unfortunately it got the best of him. Truly very sad.

This is so true. I say this from experience.  I try to make everyone happy around me and sometimes it just drains me. I know how it feels to be lonely, I know how it feels to cry and just keep everything inside so that no one sees you cry, wait till everyone is asleep and do it in silence. I don't want others to feel the way I have. I rather see them smile from ear to ear.

That is very true they dont want others to feel sadness or pain though there comes a time when they need follow their heart and be with people they love so much also and they know they cant take everyones sadness or pain away and sometimes people need face their own past just like others have done also and to.let them.do that with love and compassion and kindness
We sure miss his sweet soul, but know he is at peace now.  God bless you for sharing your take on humor with us.

Agree 100% . Regards to Robin Williams. Hiding sorrows with smile and bearing cross is being near to God.
This is so true so sad for the one who takes advantage of our kindness and doesn't realize that there are very few of us we don't come a dime a dozen

Most people are  so involved with themselves. They  just could care less. Yet they  act!!   like they care.   When I ask how are you I really want to understand you. We all need a shoulder to lean on. Or just listen.  ðŸ’–  people around me besides my family don't really care.

Very true!! I've known great pain and sadness throughout my life and I feel better assuring that I make others smile especially in bad situations because I don't want them to feel the depth of their painful situation. It's a dark overwhelming sadness that is hard to see anyone else endure.

I try and be a good friend, listening to their problems and sharing their good times., but it feels as if I am totally alone when I need someone. I do have a lot of health issues and I know two people in particular that ignore that.

I know someone dear to my heart who suffers with these issues. I'm sure there are many more, yet because they exude happiness, I cannot tell what lies beneath their pain and sadness. I love you and you know who you are. Big hugs.

There is something called, "Pagliacci Syndrome."  thought I had made it up, but turns out, I didn't. The sad  clown. Freddie Printz was another, of these. Some depressed people are very quick and witty.
Not always sometimes miserable people can not stand to see other people happy so they will try to pull you down with them!  Very sad but it does happen!

You were an amazing person, and I felt your pain. I'm so sad that you are gone, for you brought so much joy to me. In Jesus names I pray for you and your family God's peace, Robin. Love you

This is so true, I once casually knew a colleague who was always smiling and volunteering to get everyone together after work.  She later committed suicide. I couldn't believe it as I thought she was such a happy person  ðŸ¦‹

I miss you Robin Williams. When you played a man with Parkinson's in one of your films you were a real hero. You showed the world how my husband lived before he died. So real. You will never be forgotten.

Absolutely right, we try everyday to fill other peoples hearts with love and kindness and let them know we care about them. Sometimes we hide our sadness and pain to be able to help others that are going through more than we are, and want them to know just how important they are to us. We just need to show more compassion and love to others no matter what.
Have already had it made clear that if ever I stop laughing again. I'm in trouble...i make sure I find something funny every day (and it IS there)
I don't even think it's so much about being funny as it is feeling compassion. I mask my issues by solving others. I see that a ton in my field
Or they love bringing joy and laughter to others!! Enjoy a great joke and have found that humor makes life, more bearable!!
Sad thing is we can't make someone else happy. we can only make our -selves happy, and share that happiness with others.
it does drain to make people feel happy , but the best it to really feel happy and then making the others happy is a piece of cake ( naturally a delicious cake )  :-)
